function-help-entry.name: readCharacterData
function-help-entry.title: Read one or more character matrices
function-help-entry.description: This function reads the character data contained in Phylip, Fasta, or Nexus files. It takes as input the path to a file (if the contents of only a single file is to be read) or the path to a directory (if all of the Phylip, Fasta, and Nexus files in a directory are to be read).

argument.label: path
argument.description: A string that contains the path to a file in Phylip, Fasta, or Nexus format or the path to a directory that may contain many files in those formats.

function-help-entry.returnType: A vector of aligned character data matrices
function-help-entry.details: The readCharacterData function uses the Nexus Class Library (Lewis and Holder 2012) to read files in the Nexus format (Maddison, Swofford and Maddison 1996). A file starting with '#NEXUS' or having the file ending '.nex' will be interpreted as a Nexus file. If the file does not meet any of these criteria, the content is read to determine whether it might be a Phylip or Fasta file. The function works both on individual files and on file directories. Multiple character or data blocks in a Nexus file will be returned as an array of character matrices. A directory may contain multiple data files in different format. The function will skip the files that do not appear to be Nexus, Phylip or Fasta files.
function-help-entry.author: John Huelsenbeck

reference.citation: Maddison DR, Swofford DL, Maddison WP. 1996. NEXUS: an extensible file format for systematic information. Systematic Biology 46: 590-621.
Lewis PO, Holder M. 2012. Nexus Class Library. Version 2.1.
